summary: REQ-1 appears implemented by updating OKLCH CSS variables for primary/secondary/accent (and foreground counterparts) in both frontend/src/index.css and frontend/index.css. REQ-2 is only clearly addressed for the Admin panel section/overlay in the provided diffs; the diff summary does not provide evidence that other site sections (nav/hero/forms/cards) were updated to remove hardcoded mint/emerald/green/gray/white utilities. Several additional, non-requested styling/metadata changes are present (e.g., Orbitron font import, fade-in utilities, project_state.json feature-request entries, sidebar token additions).

missing_requirements.requirement: Replace any hardcoded mint/emerald/green/gray/white color utilities in site sections and navigation with theme token-based classes so the updated blue/turquoise/gold theme is applied consistently across the app (nav bar, hero, forms, cards, admin overlay).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows token-based class updates for the admin panel section/overlay, but does not include actual diffs for NavBar, HeroSection, Registration/Query forms, or other cards/sections; therefore there is insufficient evidence that hardcoded colors were replaced across the rest of the app.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/changed non-theming UI utilities and typography (Orbitron Google font import, smooth scrolling, fade-in animation utility classes).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on updating theme tokens and replacing hardcoded color utilities; it explicitly states not to add unrelated features or change app content/structure.
The BuildRequest only requests updating global theme color tokens for primary/secondary/accent and their foreground counterparts; sidebar token additions/changes were not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated project tracking metadata entries for new feature requests (AR-1/AR-2/AR-3) in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not request changes to project tracking/metadata files; it is scoped to theming changes in the frontend.
